Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Ruth M
Reviews.Content: Our room on the fourth floor was small but adequate, and the bed comfortable. Overlooked the back garden which, in early March, is not exactly in full bloom, but it sure beats looking out at a brick wall. Staff were very helpful with printing some documents we needed, and letting us store our luggage after check-out. Morning buffet was a bonus: juice and coffee, cereals, hard boiled eggs, ham and cheese, fruit and yogurt - more than I expected for a continental breakfast. It was easy to fill up and then just head out for a day of sightseeing, made all the easier because the tube station is just steps away. Note: some earlier reviews included nasty photos, Tripadvisor should take these down as they do NOT reflect the current state of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Cindy L
Reviews.Content: Location was great but honestly,... the bed was so bad and the place was so small.. If you don't care about sleeping no biggie because its right next to the tube station so location was greatttt

Reviews.Title: “yuk”
Reviews.Author: bod75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a night out in town. First impressions are that the hotel is uncared for - broken vending machine in reception. The back garden has got lots of stuff thrown in it. Our room was very small and when we got into bed, we realised that the duvet cover was stained. The receptionist on duty was pleasant and allocated us another, larger room - however the duvet was also filthy in that one. The bedding in the third room seemed to be cleaner, but overall the room itself was pretty shabby - greying net curtains, dirt in the corners, stained carpet. It was also incredibly noisy outside but the room was too hot to bear with closed curtains. Breakfast was adequate - toast and cereal. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Low end of london standard”
Reviews.Author: DanishCritic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok for the price and the staff is very polite. Breakfast is average. My room was very small and very hot. WIFI didn't work, but all the neighbours have unrestricted wifi. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: BKHKGal
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at a hotel in London where my room was literally the size of a closet. So I wasn't expecting much when I checked into My Place. Well I was pleasantly surprised as my room was literally the size of an attic. I stayed here for a week with a friend and the room was adequate with a fridge, closet and night stand. There is free wi-fi in the lobby and breakfast area. Breakfast was sufficient as well with toast, boiled eggs, cereal, ham, cheese, yogurt, and coffee machine.

Reviews.Title: “We left”
Reviews.Author: CharlesBern
Reviews.Content: It was planned to stay four nights, but we left after two nights. Run down hotel, very small room, the staff seemed a bit overwhelmed, rates are overpriced. The Holiday Inn Express one km away is 200% better.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: aph83
Reviews.Content: Staff on front desk helpful, room not ready for 2.45 check in, but after a massive whinge we were upgraded to another room. Upgraded makes it sound like a nicer room, but the carpets were filthy, the bath was dirty, the water took aged to heat up and there was no matress protector on the bed.... The waiting staff for the breakfast were surly, and the toast was cold. The milk was off and the selection poor. All that being said, it was only Â£65 for the two of us, which is cheap.for London so you totally get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Carolinap1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was better than I expected based on some of the past reviews. The hotel is located in Earls Court and an easy walk even with luggage from the Earls Court station. The train goes directly from the airport to that stop. They used to have an elevator that took you directly from the line to the exit (2 platforms up) but that is closed for renovations. I had to drag my luggage up a flight of stairs to 1 platform and then use an elevator to get to the exit. I got there early and I was able to store my luggage for free. Although it was about 11am I was told my room number and I was checked-in, but I had to wait until the official check-in time to go to my room. I knew that anyway so I left my luggage and began to explore the city. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast was a nice spread it consisted of coldcuts (cheese and meat), yogurt, cereal, hard boiled eggs, juice, milk, coffe and tea. The room was a very good size. It was on the 5th floor it was nicely heated. It had a wardrobe closet, dresser, an ironing board and pants press machine. The carpet was old and stained but it seemed clean. The bathroom had a full bathtub. There is a T.V but there were only 3 channels. Although the room is made up everyday the sheets were not changed during our 7 day stay. But this has been my general experience throughout my stay at various hotels throughout Europe. Overall I was happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible all throughout, dirty rooms look like they have never been kept up.”
Reviews.Author: Achobs
Reviews.Content: Seriously, stay away if you really want three stars. My fiancÃ© and I have been on European holiday staying at mostly 3 star hotels for over two weeks now. This place is by far the worst we have seen. The carpet is paper thin and visibly stained and discolored. In fact it's barely attached to the floor. The walls are doors are all scuffed and probably not received a paint job in decades. Half the lights don't work as well as our door lock. There are random tiles missing from the bathroom and the ceiling isn't fully painted. Thank goodness we are only here for 2 nights. I really am mad at myself for not picking up shop and moving to ANY other hotel we could fin after the first night. I have never felt so compelled to send a warning via review. Don't make our mistake. Spend a little extra and get a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh...if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: teresakeck
Reviews.Content: Small room, but that's expected in Europe. Rooms were poorly ventilated therefore hot for these two Texans! Staff was pretty nice. Location wasn't too bad. About 10-15 minutes via underground to most tourist destinations. Room was clean, poorly decorated, but clean. We spent most time in city so not a big deal. Overall not bad if you are on a budget and can navigate the subway easily.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for $$-don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: maryanne62
Reviews.Content: Just back from 6 nights here. It was fine, clean and very nice staff. It is a very basic place to sleep, just realize that going in, and spend your money on other things in London. Location is great for Heathrow and for tube use. Also nice grocery stores (Sainsbury one way, Marks & Spencer the other) plenty of pubs and restaurants. Coffee from the machine at breakfast is not good, but Costa coffe right down the street. Wifi only on first floor, overall not a bad hotel for the price n a very expensive City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal For The Price”
Reviews.Author: Pirocapl
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this hotel in London. It is classified as a 3-star and I think it is a 2.5 star :-) The location is PERFECT. 5 min from the Earl's Court tube station. A lot of facilities on Earl's Ct road. The hotel staff was really pleasant and they even allowed me to check-out one hour later as I had a minor delay on that day. I was given a room on the 6th floor with a view to the hotel garden. It was a double room (I shared with a friend) and unlike many similar hotels in London, you could open the window to get some fresh air! The continental breakfast wasn't anything to write home about but it was included! Free wi-fi downstairs. The only thing I didn't like was that the carpet in my room was totally stained and looked dirty. However, the bed linen was clean and I got fresh towels every day! Can't complain at all!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but Terrilbe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveladvisorNanaimo
Reviews.Content: I was relieved that we only had to stay in this hotel for two nights. It's good location doesn't make up for the dirty, run down condition. The room was incredibly small. A shelf for my suitcase was located just inside the door, but we couldn't open the door if my suitcase was open. The bed which had a rust stained mattress was smaller than a double and I was awake most of the night thinking about bed bugs (didn't see any, but condition of the mattress made me nervous). The hair dryer kept coming apart in my hands and the towels were so thin we could see through them! The continental breakfast was only served between 8:00 and 9:30, too late for most people who were touring. However, the night clerk (Rodge) was very helpful and put out a breakfast for us each morning before we left for our tours. Breakfast was coffee and toast. This is a hotel in a good location but definitely in need of major renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for London”
Reviews.Author: woody2762
Reviews.Content: My Place is well located in Earl's Court. You are close to the Earl's Court Tube Station to get anywhere you want in London. If you go to My Place expecting a Five Star experience, then you will be disappointed. I wasn't going to London to sit in my room so this was perfect. I had a single room with a twin size bed, closet, bathroom with tub/shower, TV, small desk and a refrigerator. The room was small, but the staff was incredibly nice and helpful. I would suggest this hotel for one or two people. I had a wonderful time and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good situated hotel at Earl's Court”
Reviews.Author: hey2u
Reviews.Content: Not very clean, small hotel at Earl's Court substation. We didn't try the breakfast couse of it's way too early closure at 0930. The staff was very helpful when needed. Very cheap, so good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have to ...”
Reviews.Author: Gl0be_Tr0tter88
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights here, as my company booked me in through a 3rd party ... check in was fine, but the room was not! Got a single room, with room only to turn about! And there is no safety - if you sleepwalk and kept the window open, you risk falling 4 floors down! Breakfast was a definite no no (never!) The only plus point is the location. Lots of food and shops just 1 minute away .... just used the room to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: DevonD55
Reviews.Content: appalling in every way took 2 hours to get a room that was only just acceptable, not very clean, wndow would not close,unhygenic toiletries as soap not wrapped, a dirty white roller blind that during the summer would keep anyone awake from the eary hours. breakfast apalling , what little there was was served by two females whose clothes were filthy and also doubled up for cleaning the bathrooms,{toilets} the same outfit worn three days in a row. Manageress not at all pleasant. supposed to have been inspected after complaints and reported as perfectly accepable so why bad eview August

Reviews.Title: “Good location - small hotel”
Reviews.Author: SF07
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location near Earls court station. It's easy to come by tube (blue line) from Heathrow airport. Rooms are small and not very clean, but the bathroom was ok. Breakfast is simple with coffee, tea, juices, bread etc

Reviews.Title: “What a dump! Stay away from this place.”
Reviews.Author: Gorkus
Reviews.Content: Terrible, terrible, terrible. Not even its location (5 mins walk from Earl's Court) can make me even remotely consider to stay here again. The rooms are extremely small. I had a large suitcase and I had to jump over it to get around the room. That is even worse when you know that my room had a SINGLE bed! Who has single beds??? The atmosphere feels dirty, the carpets do not invite you to walk barefoot and the shower curtain is disgusting (I do not like things stikcing to my sking while I shower....enough said!) Free Wi-fi is advertised however it is only a wish since "wireless Internet is a mistery, it comes and goes" (I am quoting the OWNER!!!) There is no proper desk in the rooms and the furniture dates from the 50's. Honestly, I could not even set my laptop on the mini stand that was there (I refuse to call THAT a desk or a table). The garden looked uncared for, however I cannot comment since I did not dare to step on it. Breakfast is as bad as it gets. I had to stay in this hotel for 4 nights during an exhibition (I will NEVER forget my travel agent for that) and I did not have one breakfast at the hotel. There are plenty of nicer places around the corner. I tried my best to change hotels however London was fully booked! Damn my luck!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: rastapastaman
Reviews.Content: Ended up in this hotel after a horrible experience with another place just a few blocks away... Rooms are clean and spacious, staff extremely courteous and friendly. Great morning breakfast with the breakfast room opening on to a lush garden. Was sunny during our stay, so spent some time just soaking up the waves with a coffee in the morning. Owner is very present on the premises and is a real GENTLEMAN! Thanks again for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small, budget-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Annabelle_Leanne
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel as my usual one was fully booked, and this one had single rooms and was good for the budget. Of course, it IS London, so I wouldn't call it cheap, but reasonable. Things to note: nice, helpful staff. Rooms are small, but if your main goal is to have a good night's rest, it's enough. Pros: nice staff, rooms reasonably clean, bathroom and shower sufficient albeit small, rooms cleaned every day, new towels etc. Continental breakfast (though I'm not a huge breakfast eater) was more than enough for me. Every part of town is easily accessible by tube, and nights are quiet. Major plus - the nearest tube is Earl's Court, which means a direct line to Heathrow. There's a small fridge in the room, which is also convenient, as well as several fast food places just around the corner. Tube is literally just a minute away. Cons/didn't disturb me very much but you might want to take into account: small rooms, small closet. Wi-Fi is free, but no signal in the room, had to go down to the lobby. To me it was really the main con of the hotel. Overall, it fitted me great, and I'd probably consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: traceyamylowe
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a lovely three days this hotel is cheap and cheerful you get what you pay for. Close to underground so easy access around London. Breakfast could be better but KFC & Macdonalds close by. Staff were nice and helpful. Rooms were ok but could have done with a window to open as it was very hot. We went as a family and would definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad, but very close to an underground full of lines”
Reviews.Author: revpex
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is that itÂ´s a 2 minute walk to the subway (underground). And at EarlÂ´s Court Station you have the Circle line, Picadilly Line and District line wich may take you to a whole different places without having to change lines. This is VERY good when youÂ´re travelling. The rooms - not bad for the price! Nothing to complain The breakfast - I think thatÂ´s the most disapointing part! Very poor breakfast...just some toasts, butter, coffee and yogurt...they should improve that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrmikeramsey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a tight budget. We are Americans and after reading reviews we were not expecting much from this place. While we are not high rollers by any stake, we were pleasantly surprised by the service and quality of the place for the price. We arrived late and the desk clerk was polite and helpful. We got to the twin room and granted it was small but we were only looking for a place to sleep and a nice shower (shower head was not the best). Beds were comfy and they even stuck a fan in the room to cool it off since we were on the 5th floor which was great. Free WiFi - but would only work close to the lobby - didn't reach the fifth floor. One day we were looking for a nice place to eat and Colin took time to draw us a map to a local place pointing out a couple of points of interest on the way. Great location VERY close to Earls Court Tube stop to get you wherever you want to go in the city. A couple of American fast food places very close too - if you are craving a cheeseburger from McDonald's. All in all it was a great stay if you are looking for a place to crash at night before heading out for a day in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: beechbum55
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week here. We were somewhat concerned about some of the older reviews, but noticed the recent ones seemed to have found an improved hotel, which seems to be the case. While it still needs significant updating, this hotel is a reasonable tourist class hotel with a great location and thus good value for the money. We stayed on the 6th floor, having read noise may be a problem in the lower rooms. The only issue was the dormers cut the ceiling height down somewhat. Rooms are small, furniture dated, bathrooms small, but always had clean towels and hot water. For longer stays it pays to bring a small bar of soap, as the ones they provide are inadequate. Breakfast is ok, but coffee terrible. However, there are a McDonalds, Starbucks and Costa Coffee all within about 200 meters. Staff was pleasant and helpful, but entirely non-British (as seems to be the case with all the service personnel in London). Great location almost next to Earls Court tube stop. Many excellent restaurants within 5 minutes walk. Check out the Blackbird Pub or Zizza's (an Italian place). For London this hotel is a good budget alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, clean, convenient, will go back”
Reviews.Author: lola2day
Reviews.Content: The second visit in two years and while it was good last time, it's really improved. New tile floors in the hallways, lots of new paint, much nicer folks at reception who helped with all our inquiries. The short walk to the earls court underground is a real treat, with the District and Picadilly lines whisking you off to most of town. Several decent pubs and other up and coming chains located nearby (Nandos, Masala Zone, Wagammama). If you are planning on stayng more than a few days, you might want to bring a few additional breakfast bits with you as the spread is identical every day. If i could suggest an improvement, tea drinkers might find the coffee machine and the small cups pitiful. I'd prefer to get a real pot of tea in the morning instead of a tiny cup with a huge teabag.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the paid price”
Reviews.Author: Gaby4ever
Reviews.Content: Located really close to Earl's court this small Hotel proposes rooms which are a little bit updated. I appreciated to havÃ© access to m'y room at 10.30 in the morning. My room had a good size. The carpet was not very clean though. Staff was helpful and gave good advice for transport and restaurants. Breakfast was simple, coffee was terrible and I decided to go to starb*cks instead. On the 6th floor no access to Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: sirdebohun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful, period. After my 8 days here, as a guest, I was exposed to a most courteous staff who assisted me beyond their duty. Every morning, after being greeted by the friendly staff, they were helpful in guiding me around London. The rooms were very nice, and, the cleanliness of this hotel was, to say the least fabulous. I will certainly book this hotel on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at My Place”
Reviews.Author: sla53
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a fantastic stay at My Place. The staff were extremely helpful, the room we stayed in was clean and functional and over-looked the garden at the back of the hotel. The Continental breakfast which was included in the room price was more than adequate and not just a croissant and coffee! Location great too- seconds from Earls Court underground.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Very nice, friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sam1111114
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I didn't quite know what to expect! But when I arrived I was greeted by very friendly and helpful staff and we were shown to our room in no time. The room I stayed in was very clean, nicely furnished and WARM! The location is great. It's not a busy street but you are literally 30 seconds walk from all the shops/ restaurants/ cafe's. If you wish to brave driving and have been filled with horror stories by parents DON'T PANIC. It's not that bad . This hotel is on the outskirts of the congestion charge. Look out for signs and large red 'C's' on the road. It's Â£10 charge everyday your car enters it and a Â£60 fine if you don't pay it (I paid it just in case but I'm a nervous wreck). The hotel doesn't provide parking but there is a good security car park (barriers/ walled / always staff present) around 20 mins walk away. It called Olympia/ Earls Court parking. Be warned you need to book on-line in advance and find the SPECIFIC car park you booked. Otherwise they'll charge you TWICE. It's already Â£36 for two days! All in all it's good value for money given it's location and compared to other London prices. It's not what I'd call 'high class' but definitely a good hotel. You'll enjoy your stay if your not expecting spectacular views (the back garden has a few 'tip like' qualities) but don't let this put you off. Inside the hotel is very very good and that's all that matters. 7/10!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money i paid!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaEmily18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at My Place hotel for new years eve 2010 for 1 night with friends, whether it was just my room or not i found the hotel great, you get what you pay for. the staff were so helpful as i had so many questions. Do not listen to what people write on here, if you know what your expecting you will be fine! There was a nightclub in the basement and although it was new years eve, i couldnt hear anything from my room on the 6th floor. It was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money paid”
Reviews.Author: virgil_10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for two nights and found everything good for GBP 69 / night. The only bad thing is that the WIFI didn't work on 6th floor where is my room Anyways i Couldn't find cheaper for same standard in London !!!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in London”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room is small, so what, it's Europe, all rooms are small get over it. I am not at all complaining about the size of the room. I would like to let people know, this is not the place to stay if you want to SLEEP AT NIGHT. Thursday through Saturday the have a "night club" and by that I mean, hole in the basement... anyway, they have live music which is very loud and can be heard from every room in the hotel. Hmmm.... seems to me people check into a hotel for a place to SLEEP while on vacation/business travel. Other than the noise from the "night club" this is a fine place to stay. Staff is 24 hours and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My Place, Disgrace.”
Reviews.Author: webbeverly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Weren't able to check into room when we arrived, rooms weren't cleaned yet. Once we checked into our room, we found stained carpets, moldy shower curtain, window that did not close so we had to fall asleep to the street noise. The breakfast was not appetizing at all and we chose not to eat it. The one thing the hotel as going for it, it is close to the Tube. We will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Place is in a great location but needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: omglol
Reviews.Content: Great location -- The hotel is very close to Earl's Court tube station; Friendly staff -- provided wake up calls and held on to luggage on the last day of stay. The hotel is very small. It's difficult to maneuver a suitcase to the room; the rooms are tiny; the sheets were clean, but the carpets, walls, and furniture need some TLC. The breakfast was ok. There was toast, jam, muesli, cereal, juice, cheese, and some type of ham, but only instant coffee was served. It got a little noisy at night and the room was quite hot. I would probably try to book a different hotel for my next visit to London. However, I would also consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money considering London standards”
Reviews.Author: BauldelaPiquer
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure about your experience in London but mine is that either you pay have of your salary and go to a decent place or you end up at some of the most crappy placed you'd ever have the chance to experince. So it was a nice surprise to find My Place hotel with its central location, its acceptable breakfast and its acceptable cleanliness, for not such a high price. The room was also big enough and staff were friendly. I'll definitively keep it in my list of possibilities when I visit London.

Reviews.Title: “My Place is OK To Say at”
Reviews.Author: TravelDeFamly
Reviews.Content: Stayed Aug 2010, Staff were helpful and Polite. Rooms were basic & Bathroom were fine . Good base to explore London. did not have the hotel breakfast went to *bucks or the bakery at earls court station or across the street. numerous markets, pubs & restaurants very close to the hotel. we had a fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: RAMELA_10
Reviews.Content: Dingy bedroom , badly stained carpet and torn lampshade , lacked any pride of appearance . However slept v well,minimum noise. Staff friendly and helpful . I was glad to leave .

Reviews.Title: “Shocking - the worst hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: stuart_6949
Reviews.Content: Room: filthy and had not been cleaned properly in years. Maitained: Nothing had been maintained in years. Food: Just terrible. Shower: Did not work. Aircon: Been disconnected. My concern if the hotel is so poorly maintained and you are sleeping upstiars whether the fire reg's are properly maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even consider this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CatharinaStockholm
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, but it was in reality far worse than I imagined. The lift was unbelievably dirty with shabby plastic flooring loose and bulging. I had a single room on the top floor in which every single piece of furniture was battered or broken. The curtain rod fell off the wall, the window did open after much violence but did not stay open since it was broken. As we are talking about mid-July (30+ degrees just under the roof) it made the stuffy room unbearable. Massive disgusting stains in the wall-to-wall carpet. I decided not to risk the breakfast and walked to Kensington High Street instead. Do not think that you are saving money by staying here - it is in fact an exorbitant price for the standard you get. My recommendation is: avoid.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO”
Reviews.Author: 155032Traveler
Reviews.Content: Dirty, very badly decorated, old, and the worst breakfast you can imagine. The kind of place that can ruine your holiday in London. What a shame to have a hotel in a nice area and not to have it runed properly ....

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller041
Reviews.Content: Stayed 19th & 20th July 2010 (Bed & Breakfast) as a base to explore London. 1. Foreign staff were polite and helpful. 2. Double Room - a. Condition shabby, old fashioned. b. No Air Conditioning (only loud fan provided) the room was extremely hot (genuinely the hottest room I have ever stayed in anywhere in the world). c. Minibar / Fridge - nothing in it. d. Small Window was at foot level. Top window up well over two metres high, would not open. e. TV - No remote control anywhere in the hotel for the TV, you had to stand on a chair and stretch to operate the TV. f. Towels changed everyday, even though on first day found there was a large rip in bath towel. g. Bathroom - difficult to get water temperature right, either cold or extremely hot. 3. Breakfast - Not English but continental (Limited selection). Coffee machine broke down. Yoke of my boiled egg was dark green, which was a bit off putting! 4. Problems with electricity - Power went off in room.

Reviews.Title: “Most misleading hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: Jennifermsims
Reviews.Content: Awful experience, don't go to this hotel. After having to extend my business trip one night we had trouble finding anything in the Kensington area on such short notice so I found My Place online - the photos could not have been more misleading. We checked in and I had doubts right away, but nothing could have prepared me for the gross, stained, dirty room where none of the appliances worked and the beds were completely sunken in - disgusting! This would have been justified at $80 a night, but not $160.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisey, barely functioning hotel”
Reviews.Author: sr86
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a room at this hotel for two nights as a budget base from which to explore London. The staff were reasonably friendly and the location is excellent (2 mins walk to Earls Court Underground). Unfortunately these turned out to be the only positive aspects of out stay. Our room was tiny. This would not have been a huge issue but the standard of it was simply terrible. The dÃ©cor was seriously outdated, the wallpaper was peeling, the bathroom ceiling was mouldy, the window was held open with a coat-hanger, the mini-bar was broken, the trouser-press was broken, the air conditioning was broken, the toilet wouldn't flush, the shower was either ice cold or as hot as the sun and there was no kettle or any luxuries to speak of. The heat was a real issue as our broken air-conditioner was replaced with a small noisy table fan which had to run throughout the night. Our window overlooked "the garden" which was simply a wasteland. There were workmen out there throughout the day burning waste, drilling and sawing. The noise was unbelievable. There was also no curtain on the window, rather a thin, see-through blind which didn't reach the bottom of the window and offered no sound-proofing and little privacy. The breakfast was laughable although it was complimentary. The meat offered with the continental breakfast looked very low-quality and frankly, I was afraid to go near it. Needless to say, we skipped breakfast on our second day. The housekeeping service appeared to be replacing the towels and making the bed. No noticeable cleaning or replacing of sheets was carried out. The free wi-fi seems like a good deal until you realise that many of the rooms (including ours) cannot access it. The final insult was the offer of looking after our bags on the final day where we were asked to leave them in the open, publicly accessible lounge where anyone could have strolled in and taken them. When we went back to get them I made a point of letting the receptionist know we had picked them up which was met with a confused and disinterested response. This hotel is not value for money. It is simply cheap. If you are looking for somewhere to stay keep your hopes low and you may be able to bear it. We, on the other hand, could not wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Quite Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AngloAustrian
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews, I was a bit worried. We booked a package deal with Virgin from US to London and had two hotels to choose from. So, this is our last night and here is the scoop. Americans, be warned. This is an old house converted to a hotel. The rooms are small, the hotel is dated and slowly being renovated, the bathrooms small, the light switches in weird places, no coffee etc in rooms, wifi worked in our rooms (two) and yes, the back yard is messy. However, non Americans who are less spoiled will appreciate that it is a clean place to sleep, you get used to the lights very quickly, water was hot, and we slept like logs. We had rooms on the first floor, both with balconies, so that meant our children had to sleep with the windows/ balcony doors closed. If you want to be able to keep your windows open all night, request a higher floor. I read that washcloths were not provided, and this is correct, so I brought my own. Internet worked fine. Breakfast was not the greatest (canned juices, ham, cheese, muesli etc.) but my family LOVED unending toast and marmalade, and we were very happy. Service was good, especially Elizabeth who served in the morningsand did the rooms, and all in all, if you want something central, get a good deal on the rooms, don't mind adapting to small rooms and just grooving with the great experience of London,then I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a clean warm room to rest at nights, this might be the place”
Reviews.Author: noproblemSetx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The My Place Hotel for six nights. Read the reviews after I had made the reservation and was quite anxious as to what I would get. Well we had two rooms. My room faced the street and was basic and not bad except for one night, it was cold and windy. The shades at the windows kept flapping from the draft coming in. I had to use towels and bottles of water to hold the blind down to keep the draft out and the noise down. Apparently. this was a recently renovated room. My sister's room on the other had, a lot to be desired. The furnishings was worn, mismatched and dated. The bed lumpy and uncomfortable. The view from her window revealed a trash pile in the back yard of the property. The best things about the hotel is the location, very central to just about anywhere in London. The under ground is about 2 minutes away and has the District and Circle lines. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The free continental breakfast was worthwhile. Lots of good places to eat on the main street by the hotel. I would stay at The My Place Hotel if I could guarantee getting the same room that I had and if I couldn't afford something else.

Reviews.Title: “An unprofessional checkin on arrival...”
Reviews.Author: Theupperchase
Reviews.Content: An unprofessional checkin on arrival. Rooms are small, dated and tired. No tea or coffee in the room. My key card did not access my room for the second night. Wifi doesn't work in all areas of the hotel. The garden looks likes an untidy mess. Light switch fir the bathroom is in the wardrobe !!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here! It is filhty!! I found bugs in my bed!!”
Reviews.Author: Maverick325
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to London for a business trip. I travel frequently for business and I'm not picky about my hotels..as long as the room is clean and the neighborhood is safe, I'm satisfied. The hotel website looked great. As I entered my room, I was shocked by how dirty and smelly it was. The courtyard was FULL of trash and rotten fruit. I left for lunch and when I returned, realized that my room had NO heat...I could see my breath! I called the front desk and they said, " Well, he repairman is too busy. Call back later". I called back 30 min later, and was told, "Sorry, no one can help you". At this point,, I was so exhausted as I'd just flown in from the US. So, I decided that maybe if I got under the bedcovers and fell asleep, I wouldn't notice how cold I was. I pulled the covers back and found a BUG! I immediately went downstairs to check out and demanded a refund. The manager (male, approximately 50 years old ) refused to give me a full refund and said, "First you complain about no heat, now it's bed bugs, what is it now?... I don't believe you". Can you believe this!? Luckily I went across the street to the Trebivor Hotel. It cost less money and it was MUCH nicer and MUCH cleaner!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & breakfast, near the tube stations and many fast foods/restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Temporary22
Reviews.Content: I have been there twice already, I liked it. Its simple,clean and the breakfast is nice. Its not a posh hotel with brethtaking rooms but its all you need when you're staying a few days in London to visit the city. What I like the most is the area where its located, it has a lot of stores, shops and places where you can go have dinner or lunch ('BENJI' PEOPLE!). I usually recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but definately budget”
Reviews.Author: lovelyjmb
Reviews.Content: I booked our trip through Air France Holidays because we were doing a London & Paris trip, so Air France actually picked the hotel for me. I read the reviews here before I went so I knew what to expect, and everyone is pretty spot on. It's great that this hotel is affordable and a block from the Underground station but I think I would have rather stayed in a different area at a slightly better hotel since I was staying there for 3 days. It was a tiny room of course so our bags were pretty much in the way of any walking path. And there was some stain on the wall that I think was just from wear and tear of people using the room and the hotel not bothering to renovate. It was nice to have the breakfast included in the dining room (your basic cereal, coffee, toast - you can get eggs for an additional cost). And the front desk was very nice, however when I asked for a local Indian restaurant since London has many, I was told not to go to any in the area because they're not good. But the Thai restaurant, Wagammas, was right down the street and very tasty. We were going to check out the "night club" that's attached but it's only open on the weekend and we were there during the week. Also, I could hear the noise on the street from my window since we were close to the ground, but my husband is a sound sleeper and said he didn't hear anything. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel if you're looking for something cheap for 1 night. But if you plan to stay a few days, maybe switch to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good if u only sleep there”
Reviews.Author: SergeyStarodub
Reviews.Content: small hotel, but it deff needs repair good if u only spend there night sleeping ))) plus is that there is a great place called Nando's which is specialized in chicken. great place for those who love spicy food.

Reviews.Title: “great location but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: SalisburySam
Reviews.Content: great for earls court + olympia. just off high street with plenty of restaurants. But hotel itself has dark blue furnishings in small rooms with dark wood wardrobes etc = claustifobic. paint peeling off walls - especially bathroom. menu states 24 hours but is not. only reason to book this hotel is for the address

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful”
Reviews.Author: maryellen0
Reviews.Content: I cannot easily put into words just how terrible this hotel is. It is an absolutely disgusting place. The carpet was worn and dirty, there were mystery scratches on the walls, mould on the bathroom ceiling and my skin scrawled while I was in the bed thinking about when the duvet and cover were last washed (probably never). We stayed on the 6th floor with air conditioning that didn't work and a fan that made so much noise it couldn't be left on while the weather was very hot and sticky. While there my boyfriend conducted a test - the drinking glasses left in the room were initially on a cupboard on one side of the room, and after he drank from his, he left it upright on the bedside table. When the housekeeper had been in to 'clean' the room, the glass was simply left on the bedside table the other way up, without having been cleaned. Each evening on returning to the room, the bed looked like it had been made by a 7 year old. I also suspect that they didn't change the towels. We could not bring ourselves to eat the breakfast. A really horrible experience that completely coloured my whole trip to London. Don't ever stay in this hole, it should probably be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “best location i have ever had in my many trips to london”
Reviews.Author: travelingoldlady
Reviews.Content: this hotel, is the most convenient of any hotels i have stayed in while visiting london. granted, small rooms and only adequate breakfast, but the service was excellent. i shall use this again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, perfect budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: hismissusNewYork
Reviews.Content: The My Place Hotel came with an incredible package that we booked. Airfare AND hotel for the two of us was just about $200.00 more than JUST the airfare we paid for ONE of us when we were last in the UK in July 08. After booking, I looked up My Place here....and started to get nervous! There was absolutely nothing to worry about however! I would stay at My Place again in a heartbeat! Let's begin with location - less than a 1 minute walk from the Earl's Court tube station - you cannot ask for more convenience!! We took the tube from Heathrow airport, and were at the hotel in no time. Once you have settled in, there are more choices than you will know what to do with for food options. Within five minutes walking distance, you can find French, Italian, English, Lebanese, Indian, Chinese, &c, &c, and for those who want it - McDonald's, Burger King, Starbucks and KFC. There is a bakery for pasteries and coffee in the morning, a shop right at the tube station for Cornish pasties, and for excellent late night food (open till 4am on weekends!) the Star Kebab House. The hotel itself offers a continental breakfast included with the price of the room, but if you want a full English, skip the hotel's offering at Â£9.95 per person extra and walk across the street to Benji's and you can have TWO full English breakfasts - at any time of the day no less! - for Â£9.99. There are at least four pubs within a one minute walk of the hotel, all of which offer food as well. For late night drinks, look no further than the nightclub in the basement of the My Place Hotel! While we were there, the club was only opened on Friday and Saturday nights till 2am, and we took advantage of this once the pubs shut (last call is generally around 10:30pm, unless the establishment is licensed to be open later). The club may be open more often during the Summer tourist season - check with the hotel when you book. There is also a late night lounge called Mango on the Earl's Court Road, which is opened til 2am Mon thru Sat. The My Place Hotel is also within walking distance to TONS of things to do/see! Kensington Palace and gardens are less than 1 mile walking, The Victoria & Albert and the Natural History museums are about 1 mile away, Brompton Cemetery is about a ten minute walk. The Baden-Powell House is less than a mile away. The tube puts everything else you will want to do within reach...I just cannot stress the perfect location enough!! Next - our room. Small, but clean and comfortable. Do not go there will expectations of the Holiday Inn, because European accommodations differ from what Americans are used to. If you want familiar, book a Hilton hotel. If you are after a budget conscious hotel, you will be well pleased. The bed was great, the pillows and duvet were comfy, there is a mini fridge (Note - NOT a mini bar!!) in the room, there was tons of hot water, and great water pressure in the shower, they offer a limited room service menu (LOTS of drink options, not so many food options), they have free coffee and tea in the downstairs lounge at most times, there is a hairdryer in the room, and the flatscreen TV in our room offered three channels - but who goes on holiday to watch tv anyway??? The bedspreads and towels were a bit tired and frayed, but I did not expect otherwise for the price. Contrary to other reviews, we were not plagued by bed bugs, and there were no odd smells or stains in the room. The carpets in the hallways are old and threadbare, that I will concede. We could not hear the nightclub from our 3rd floor room. We did hear our neighbour's television at six am, but he/she must have checked out that day, as we only heard it the once. I was almost dissappointed to have NOT seen the infamous Hoover in the hallway!! Breakfast - continental includes coffee/tea, juices, toast, hard boiled eggs, cold cereals, yoghurt, cheese, canned fruit, and packaged sliced ham. Meager, but acceptable. Tea/coffee is available throughout the day. Room service is limited, but available. All of the supermarket chains are within walking distance, so you can keep all sorts of supplies in your room in the mini fridge. The staff was great! All very friendly and helpful. We came and went at all times of the day/night, and all employees were always pleasant. They have a room available to store your luggage should you arrive earlier than check in, or wish to leave it for a few hours after check out (as we did). We had a great experience at the My Place Hotel. We would recommend it to friends and family. We would return again.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss? My Place served us well!!”
Reviews.Author: lolatoday
Reviews.Content: My mom, aunt, and I spent a lovely week at My Place in April and we found it to be more than adequate for a week stay. Our room and ensuite was clean, adequate room for 3, breakfast well presented, and the desk staff were helpful (all shifts!). The location (less than a block from Earls Court Tube and Bus stops) was superb. In the last 3 years, Earls Court has really cleaned up it's act. There's nearby dining at 3 good quality chains (Nandos, Wagamamma, and Masala Zone), Boots is just up the street, and a short walk to a modern Sainsbury's if you need anything. It fit our budget and we were pleased to stay there. Yes, we saw the Hoover too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: acourtesan
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at MyPlace for 7 days during our Anniversary Holiday. I had read the reviews and was scared, but pleasantly surprised by our room. We were on the top floor, had some weird window covering over the window, (which we finally got rolled up). We had a great time. We visit London not for the room but for the ambiance of being in another country for our Thanksgiving/Anniversary Holiday. The room was tiny, but after 21 years I can sleep anywhere with my Husband. I did see the infamous hoover vacuum cleaner laying on the floor by the lift, but we just stepped over it everyday! Overall we had a great time(I think because the disco was closed?) Super close to the tube, lots of places to eat, and staff very helpful. Would definitely stay there again. Just remember, this is a budget hotel....

Reviews.Title: “This would never be my place”
Reviews.Author: tgp66
Reviews.Content: We were offered this hotel by hotels4u, when the one we wanted was fully booked. When we exited the lift there was a hoover laying on the floor in front of the fire exit, it was still there when we checked out. The room was small and stuffy, it had 2 windows that didn`t open, thats because 3/4`s of one window went to the room above and 3/4`s of the other one went into the room below, which meant if you wanted to look out, you had to stand on a chair or lay on the floor, this alone would have affected my booking if i had been told, as i like to be able open windows. There was no tea and coffee in the room and the mini bar was empty.The tv had 5 stations but you could`nt watch them as the aerial was the kind you would find on your nan`s caravan, and will only give a good picture if you stand on one foot and hold the aerial above your head. The bathroom door didn`t shut and the bathroom itself was filthy, it had not been cleaned properly for a long time and the toilet brush and holder was disscusting, the bath drain didn`t work and the toilet was covered in limescale. There can be no checking of rooms before they are sold. The continental b/fast was processed cheese, processed ham and tinned fruit salad, we were pleased that mcdonalds was so close by. The location is good and the owners are missing a trick, the staff are very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A Bittersweet Stay”
Reviews.Author: Coax74
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, I put myself on a tight budget for vacation this year and booked a package 6 night deal to London and the My Place Hotel was chosen because of budget considerations. I read mixed reviews here on trip adviser but of course it was too late to change hotel accommodations and I just hoped for the best. My first hint that this hotel was weird was that it was the only one in the row of hotels along Trebovir street that had a neon sign while all the other hotels were much more subdued. Another hint was the coach driver who dropped me off said that this was a "lively section of town." The girls who manned the front desk my entire stay were extremely nice, accommodating, and helpful in getting me adjusted to English time and various landmarks. I have nothing but high praise for these ladies and realize the faults of the hotel are not their responsibility. Upon entering my room for the first time, I noticed that it was small and stuffy. Okay, no big deal, I'm a single guy and expected a small room from the reviews I had read. I also noticed that the carpet was stained as was the comforter on my bed and the refrigerator was filthy. The bed had only one small flat pillow and I had to ball up an extra bed cover to put under the pillow to keep my head up and my neck from being strained (I have a big head, what can I say). The bathroom was surprisingly clean but at night when I went to utilize the toilet, I would turn on the light and see tiny bugs (possibly roaches) scurrying away to hide. The front door was not sealed at the bottom so there was about a 1 inch gap from the door to the floor. This created a problem mainly in that, even though these were "No Smoking" rooms, people smoked anyway and the smoke would creep under my door and choke me out at night. I eventually put a towel down under the door before I went to sleep which solved the problem. The phone didn't work. At least the receiver didn't. I tried to call someone twice and they couldn't hear me on the other end so I gave up on using the phone. Keep this in mind, those two uses of the phone lasted a total of only 10 seconds, 15 tops. I mention that only that you will keep it in mind at the conclusion of my review. 70% of the time my electronic key did not work in the door. I had to continuously go up and down the stairs (the elevator was out of service half the time) and get the front desk person to "reset" my key. Sometimes that didn't even work and the front desk person had to come up and personally open my door. The first few times it happened I brushed it off, but as it continued to be a problem, I started to get extremely annoyed. There is no "Do Not Disturb" door tag that you can hang on the door handle outside your room. Why is this a problem? Well, I got sick one day and was completely out of commission. Around 11:00 AM as I'm trying to catch up on sleep that being sick the night before had deprived me of, the cleaning person comes and tries to enter the room. I have the door deadbolted from the inside so she can't enter. Again, again, and again she tries then she bangs on the door. I eventually get up, open the door and politely tell her that I do not want to be disturbed. She says she HAS to clean my room. I tell her it's not necessary for that day. Luckily she was nice about it and asked if I needed anything (facial, bathroom tissue, etc...) and gave me some fresh towels. Don't count on wake up calls. There was one time that I was actually woken up on time. On the day I was checking out of the hotel, I requested a 6 a.m. wake up call. I actually woke up earlier than expected, got my things together and by the time I headed downstairs, it was 6:15 a.m. I know this because I was watching the local news and that's the time they had as well as the time I had on my watch. So much for the wake up call I was hoping to receive. So when I go to check out, I'm greeted by a man at the front desk. The fact that he was a man isn't the bad thing, I was just hoping one of the people I knew were actually helming the desk on check out. I tell him I'd like to check out, hand him my key, and ask him if that's it. Now here's where it turns shady. Remember those brief phone calls I placed and couldn't complete because the phone was broke? This guy says "It looks like you owe 60 pounds for phone use." I stared at him with mouth agape. I told him that's impossible as I only used the phone twice, briefly, and that the phone was essentially useless in the room I was in. At which point he kind of nervously looks around and tells me don't worry about it. I turned and left with the sinking feeling that he was trying to rip me off. Caveat emptor everyone. If/when I head back to London on a budget, the My Place Hotel will NOT be where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Plommeni
Reviews.Content: Reading all the warnings, made us anticipate the worst. Phoning the hotell in advance to ask for Ã¥ nice room, seemed to help. This is a quite run down hotell, and would requiere a major face lift to bring the hotel to the standard we are used to in our country, Norway. That aside, friendly atmosphere and great location. We had a wonderful London weekend, and an usterile and absense of a high tech environment gave a romantic and adventures touch. Had this been in India it would have been pretty OK.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Good About This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveEide
Reviews.Content: My room was extremely small, even for London. It was dirty, carpet, walls and bathroom. TV and refrigerator did not work. Mold in the soap dish. Never cleaned toilet. Had to beg for toilet paper and soap and they never vacuumed until I complained. The terrace off my room was gross, filthy and was a virtual ash tray. Very noisy on the the weekend (club in basement). The "continental breakfast" was a farce. Dried thin slices of meat and cheese and dry cereal. The waiter(?) reluctantly took our order for breakfast off the menu. Horrible! I could not change hotels due to booking a package. Oh well, I still loved London!

Reviews.Title: “Great place ...”
Reviews.Author: sigu655
Reviews.Content: I don't know who these people are who wrote those bad reviews. This place was excellent. I loved where it was - so EASY to get to and from many places in London. There was a club downstairs. Plenty of places nearby to eat. An Internet store right around the corner. Plenty of bars and convience stores. Nice area to just walk around and see the sites. Where the hell were some of these people staying at? The service was great. If I had a problem with the room I'd just called the front desk. That's it. Period .. end of story. I didn't see any mode or dirt or anything like that and if I did...who cares? Yeah the TV wasn't all that but I didn't fly over 3000 miles to see TV..besides, the shows weren't all that great. It's not the Hilton or the Ritz....Heck, it's not even the Holiday Inn BUT it's a great little place you can call home for whatever time you're planning to spend in London. The management was FANTASTIC and that's all I gotta say about that. Don't listen to the negative people.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: BettyoSpaghettio
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous poor reviews of the My Place Hotel, I was apprehensive about my stay. Our 3 nights there turned out to be just fine though. The location was right near the metro stop, it was never too loud outside, the TV worked fine, the breakfast was basic, the staff was friendly, and the room was spacious. I did bring a sleeping bag just in case bed bugs appeared, but the sheets were clean. One downside was that the bathroom shower curtain had some mold on it. The water pressure was fine though, and the temperature of the water was good. There were a couple small stains on the rug, but the room was very clean. The decor of the room was just as it is pictured on the website. I liked that there was plenty of space to lay out our clothes. Overall I was not as disappointed in the room as I had anticipated I would be. I'm not sure if this is a hotel for older travelers or families ... but it was fine for us twenty-somethings. If I went back to London I would definitely stay elsewhere, but I am not upset about this visit at all. The accomodations were average.

Reviews.Title: “How to ruin a London visit”
Reviews.Author: SashMumbai
Reviews.Content: Possibly the only charitable one can say about the hotel is the location, pretty close to earl's court station. Everything but everything else is on the downwards slide The TV in my room didn't work inspite of repeated complaints, the carpets in the rooms and passages always manage to get me and my wife into bouts of allergy, the so-called Victorian look might have more in common with a pigsty, the food doesn't change, ever, the water for the morning cuppa is always cold or lukewarm , never hot, never ever and... I could just go on Do yourself a favour- stay on the station, stay with a stranger, stay anywhere, but don't stay here

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else”
Reviews.Author: passport1
Reviews.Content: If you have a choice, don't stay here. If you're already booked, don't panic. Three of us, each in a single room, stayed here the first week in January (booked through a Virgin package). No bugs in any of the three rooms, although carpet and bedspread were stained. Rooms were small, even by European standards. So hot that even in 30 degree weather the window had to be open all the time. Dingy, and housekeeping didn't do much each day except make the bed and give us a fresh towel. Continental breakfast very limited. Staff unknowledgable, although friendly enough. But location is great, less than a minute from the tube. Number of good restaurants nearby. Prince of Teck doesn't look like much, but great food.

Reviews.Title: “Standard, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: EdTed
Reviews.Content: Hotel was okay, about average for location. The location is the major plus from the hotel, 30 seconds from earls court tube station. Check in was okay, but receptionist had poor customer service, she didnt know where i could park my car (on street parking outside - but she didnt know how much it would cost or if i could even park there) she also didnt know tube locations for attractions. Apart from that, room was okay, quite small but okay for a night, bed a bit hard but the tv had a lot of channels. I would recommend it, but only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly Sub-standard”
Reviews.Author: theodocia
Reviews.Content: We did not have bugs or any other serious problem during our stay, but wouldn't stay here again. The AC was broken, making it very stuffy and hot. The only thing that saved us was a provided oscilating fan. The elevators did work, and the receptionists were always nice. But, the place is just dingy and in need of some repairs and upkeep. The breakfast looked discusting, and the toilet did take some getting used to. It had to be flushed a certain way to make it fully flush. If you do stay here, the tube is extremely convenient, and the bakery across from the tube is fabulous!! "happy hour breakfast" from 8-9 am include 2/1 pound pastys and sausage rolls, plus great lunch deals. and there's a cheap internet cafe across from the tube that is convenient. All in all, there are definetly better and cheaper hotels out there. My Place definetly needs to be cleaned up and I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare, never again”
Reviews.Author: brown_7
Reviews.Content: I was bitten by bedbugs from face to toes. Still have scars mentally and physically.Switched on the lights and bed was coveredin bugs!!!

Reviews.Title: “fun weekend”
Reviews.Author: LondonLaz
Reviews.Content: Great for romatic or dirty weekend. friendly staff, modern rooms with a cool library downstairs. only stayed one night but would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this filthy hell hole”
Reviews.Author: rebsA2z
Reviews.Content: Should have posted earlier, but I forgot to verify my review. I agree with all negative reviews. I booked 5 nights online, as I work in London during the week. This is the worst hotel ever and I have stayed in hotels for years due to my worik. It was filthy complete with dust in all the furnishings. Sheets looked clean but the outer bedding was stained with goodness knows what. A window that was flush with the floor, yes it opened at floor level, with no ledge or balcony to stop you from falling out. I have returned covered in bites. no fan in the bathroom. Do not drink the complimentary tea/coffee in reception. The water smelled like a potty. I avoided the breakfast. I wish I'd read reviews before I stayed there. There are plenty of hotels near the tube. You do not need this one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible maid service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tamiqua
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably one of the closest you can get to a tube station which made it great for us. Earl's court has elevators too so that helps with luggage. We got a triple to receive more space and thought it was fine re: sq. feet. Staff was ok- sometimes helpful, sometimes clueless. We like continental breakfast so that was fine. The room was quiet on the third floor. The maid did not clean the sink or refill supplies that were running low. The shower was somewhat dirty, air did not work well, and we found a bug in our bed although I did have the window open for a bit the day before so it could have gotten in then. We also found a lizard in under the door but just removed it and plugged the bottom of the door. Interesting for London! We rate this hotel OK.

Reviews.Title: “A Sub-standard Place”
Reviews.Author: jant56
Reviews.Content: Anything negative you have read in other reviews - believe it all! This property is rated Standard and this mature couple's opinion is that it is far from it. We had requested non-smoking & were told at check-in that they don't have any non-smoking rooms. They said each room is treated after the guest leaves and most guests don't smoke. I guess the frequent smell of smoke is from the disco in the basement. Also, we were told whenever we left the building we had to leave them our one room key at the front desk. At check-in we each had to fill in an extensive questionnaire and they wanted us to write down our Passport #'s which we refused to do. We said that was very personal information and there was no need for it especially since the room had been previously paid for and we arrived with a voucher. We stayed on a weekend and there was a lot of noise until about 3 am. The room was extremely hot even though the heating unit was turned off and no a/c was available. We couldn't open the window because it was really a balcony door just one floor up and over the disco and there was no screen. There was junk (like old tiles), food wrappers and filthy ashtray loaded with butts all out on the floor of the balcony. The hallways, rooms and furnishings are shoddy, broken and unclean. The TV didn't work, they said they would look at it and didn't. The tub drain was all backed up and my husband proceeded to clean out about one pound of human hair from the drain. The room furniture was very dark in color and not dusted for sometime. The continental breakfast was very basic with lower quality meat and only white toast. The tablecloths were all wrinkled and stained; the staff brushes off crumbs with their hands onto the floor and your chair when you leave. Many of the dishes were dirty, chipped and stained. We actually tried to book another hotel in the middle of the night and would have left if we could have arranged a room at the Holiday Inn Kensington where we had stayed in the beginning of our trip. Our 2 day stay was extremely uncomfortable and my husband was very depressed and upset with the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: NHlass
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and although the breakfast wasn't quite as portrayed in the picture overall it was a good value. The rooms were acceptable size and the location was great. There were plenty of places to eat, including McDonalds within a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nits in the bed AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: LucilleW
Reviews.Content: Three of us spent the week of Jan 8-15 at My Place. On the trip home, my friend realized she had been bitten severly by bed bugs. I've never heard of anything like that happening in a hotel. It was obvious from the first that the room had not been vacuumed under the beds and along the walls since the carpet was installed. We did not report this because we figured extra vacuuming would really stir up the dirt and make us sick. Sheets were not changed except for one bed per request. The sheer over the window was absolutely filthy. If it were mine, I'd throw it away and not bother washing it, that bad. We left the bathroom fan on constantly when we were in the room, to muffle sounds, very effective but SO tired of hearing it! The view out the back was of stacked mattresses and rolls of carpet, not a pleasant sight, nor one that instills confidence. On floor 5, our floor, carpet in hall is filthy. Room is very small; we knew that. On the flip side: location is great, the underground tube being so close. I left my purse in the dining room after breakfast one morning, missed it an hour later, found it was turned it at the front desk, nothing missing. The staff responded well to our requests. This could be a charming place if it were CLEAN!

Reviews.Title: “Do you like sleeping with strangers and listening to loud music late at night???”
Reviews.Author: London111
Reviews.Content: Nits in the Bed, Loud noise from the nightclub directly into room and awful service with no apologies for reallife crawling nits in my bed. Food was complete garbage in the morning also. A Health risk. Also I had no window really, it was a tiny floor window. Toilet did not work either but was fixed. So if you like sleeping with Strangers in your bedand Listnening to loud music late into the night please go to this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: eenissle
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here the week between Christmas and New Years and we thought overall it was a great value. Granted, we weren't expecting the Ritz at the prices we paid, but really it was not that bad. I will say that the room could have been a bit cleaner for me but I am a little obsessed with cleanliness. The fridge was not very cold, but it worked for the drinks we put in there. We had a hard time figuring out how to use the TV at first, but then we realized that there were INSTRUCTIONS on the night table! I will definitely agree with one of the former reviewers when she said to watch out for the first step out of the shower. I almost cracked my head on the mirror! But the water pressure was awesome, better than I have at home. One thing that surprised me (I haven't stayed in a hotel in London before - only lived in a flat) was that they didn't provide you with washcloths, only towels. Maybe that's a European thing, I don't know, but if that will bother you, bring your own washcloths. Also, the shampoo and soap they provide is minimal, so if you are picky bring your own. My sister and I cracked up when we walked into our "double" room and discovered that that meant there was one double bed. Ah well, we have slept in the same bed many times before. Surprisingly the bed was very comfortable and the covers were warm. The heat didn't appear to work the first day we were there, but from then on it was fine. We were nervous about the quality of the hairdryer they provide, but it was great. The free breakfast was an excellent value. While we were there it included sliced cheddar cheese, sliced deli ham, hardcooked eggs, cornflakes, muesli, milk, orange juice, toast and coffee or tea. The staff were very nice. When you leave the hotel for the day you have to turn in your key to the front desk. I was a little apprehensive about this but it seemed to work out. The reception is open 24 hours a day. They do offer wireless internet throughout the hotel for if you bring your laptop. There is a fee for it, but since I didn't use it, I couldn't tell you what that was. The location was excellent. Given London's superb underground system, as long as you are close to a Tube station you are set. In this case Earl's Court Tube station is literally a hop, skip and a jump away. This is great for when you are exhausted from jet lag and just want to crawl into bed after the end of a long day, instead of walking a half of a mile to your hotel. Also a bonus is that the station is handicap accessible which means that you don't have to lug your bags up multiple flights of stairs/escalators (which is not unusual depending on the Tube station in London). Another plus for location is that there is a cafe with free internet located next door to Earl's Court Tube station. It is called Cafe Milano and if you buy something there (coffee, etc.) you can use their computers upstairs for free. The computers are a bit dodgy at times but for free it's not bad. Overall, I'd say if you are going to London to see the sights, choose MyPlace Hotel! If you are going to London to relax and enjoy luxury, pick another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Dandybanger
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't that bad, the staff on reception were pleasant, and it's location is good, close to the earl's court underground and in a decent area. The rooms were clean, with a nice bathroom and the bed was fine. However the room was very small, and the fridge was next to the bed which was quite loud. The walls are thin so it can get noisy when other guests are moving around and there is no lift, but all in all for the price it was good. I'd stay again if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Over all a good value.”
Reviews.Author: RicSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Great location (Earl's Court) a short tube ride to anywhere in London. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are small (all rooms in Europe are small by US standards) but clean with a personal safe in the room. I've stayed here three times and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, Not great”
Reviews.Author: miamood
Reviews.Content: The hotel was part of a vacation package for me and my boyfriend and was very reasonably priced. But as mentioned elsewhere, you get what you pay for. The location is wonderful. Just be sure to exit the Earl's Court tube in the direction of the "Earl's Court Road" signs and NOT toward the "Warwick" exit, where you'll encounter stairs and more stairs, and no lift. Front desk was very friendly and helpful when in need of suggestions for a good place to eat. And honest! I needed to get on-line and the receptionist said I could use the computer in their lounge, but that the computers around the corner at the McDonald's were cheaper to use (about 2 pounds for 2 hours). Not much praise for the cleaning staff. They basically made up the bed each day the way I use to when I was 12 years old - just yanked the blankets up under the pillows. I don't think they vacuumed either, and we were there for 6 nights. And watch out for that first step out of the bathtub, itâ€™s a doosey! This tub had to be at least 2 Â½ feet high, so make sure you stretch your legs before attempting to get in and take a shower. They have a club in the basement of this hotel, and I was awoken by one of the drunken revelers on the second night. He was literally howling in the streets â€“ so I suggest asking for a room not facing Trebovir road. That said, if you make an effort to leave early each morning for sightseeing and return late each night after hard partying, then this hotel will work for you. I will likely upgrade to a larger hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not what Americans expect, but adequate for sightseers.”
Reviews.Author: woodstove
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I just returned from a six-night stay in Room 106. Absolutely the best thing about this hotel is its proximity to the Earls Court Tube. The neighborhood seemed safe enough, but our only view of it was on our way to and from the underground, so that's our fault. We were very lucky to have access to fresh air because of the balcony that ran along the whole second floor. However (and this is important to know), the door to the balcony didn't lock. Mysterious puddles of water appeared on the bathroom floor on a couple of nights. Staff said "someone upstairs took a shower and left the shower curtain out of the tub." You be the judge. In general, the staff are cheerful -- basically, they've heard your complaints before, they'll do what they can. The breakfasts were fine. Cable TV didn't work but we like the BBC anyway. We didn't have a lot of money to spend, and we got what we paid for. We had so much fun sightseeing in London that we didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, cramped and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Pengy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in late July at My Place Hotel. It was a truly appaling experience! The hotel is not clean and even the rooms were dirty and so hot and small. Breakfast is included but is just bread; cooked breakfast must be pre-ordered at around 8 pounds stirling. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cute But Dirty”
Reviews.Author: eztraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at My Place Hotel in May 2006. There were 4 of us so we had 2 rooms across the hall from each other. I will say the hotel staff was very friendly. That is about the only nice thing to say about this hotel during our 7 night stay. My Place could be a very nice hotel if it were clean. The carpet in both of our rooms was badly stained, the wallpaper was very dirty, the shower curtains and tile had mildew everywhere. I don't think the tablecloths in the breakfast room were changed the whole week we were there. They had jelly and coffee stains all over them. The lobby had a horrible odor that about knocked you out when you walked in the door. We asked for a 6:00 am wake up call one morning and never received it. It is a good thing we woke on our own or we would have missed our 7:30 train. Would we stay here again? No, our vacation would have been much better if we were coming back to a clean room each night.

Reviews.Title: “A Tad Bit Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Maggie63
Reviews.Content: I returned yesterday from a week's stay at My Place Hotel in London. I mostly found it to be just okay. Certainly, the biggest plus is its close proximity to the Earl's Court tube station, maybe a minute away. The hotel staff was always very polite and respectful; the toast was always plentiful at breakfast; and a clean towel was on my bed daily. But staying on the 4th floor in the front of the building was NOISY so I had to sleep with earplugs (which worked just fine!) On closer inspection, my room was just not very clean; sheets were never changed, there was garbage behind the dresser (I plugged in MY hairdryer as their's was nearly impossible to use), and they never replaced our used glassware. But the single most annoying part of my stay was the 3 GBP charge when I checked out. I couldn't imagine what it could have been for and was so surprised to find out it was for 2 diet cokes that were offered to my traveling partner and I upon our arrival (after a very long overnight flight, severe delays coming in from Heathrow on the Piccadilly line, and record-setting heat). I mean, geez, they even offer "Complimentary tea and coffee on arrival" according to their website. Shame on them!

Reviews.Title: “A Small and Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: VeroBeachFrank
Reviews.Content: I picked My Place for our one-week stay in London off a list provided by the tour operator - and it was the cheapest. We planned not to be at the hotel except to sleep so I figured we could endure just about anything - and London is expensive! We were surprised and very pleased with this small, friendly hotel. It's just a block and around the corner from the Earl's Court Tube Station so it's convenient to everything - from Heathrow to the City. Our room was small but very clean and overlooked the courtyard. There are plenty of small restaurants and pubs in the neighborhood and we enjoyed sampling many of them. The front desk staff is very helpful, too. There are also several shops that offer prepared sandwiches and other items for a quick, easy meal. Of course, with the great breakfast buffet that the hotel provides, you don't need much for lunch. One caveat: My Place is not airconditioned. We stayed in May and the room was very comfortable. I probably would not stay there in the summer. But, if you're bargain travelers as we are, you won't be there in the summer anyways. So, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: mep01
Reviews.Content: Right around the corner from tube station and Earls Court Rd shopping and eating. At first impression I thought sad and tired and over-rated, yet I was in for a big surprise. I was staying there for a week from 15 September, so they gave me a room overlooking rear courtyard, 3 floors up and diagonally opposite the nightclub in the basement. Had a double bed with doona, small wardrobe, 2 luggage racks, antique dressing table and stool, smallish but adequate bathroom. My room was right next to the new lift but because the bathroom was between it and the bed I never heard a thing. Breakfast was basic - cereal, toast, juice, eggs, ham and cheese. If you wanted a proper English Breakfast, you had to order it the night before and pay for it - never bothered. Reception was small so security was good. I picked this hotel up for GBP59 per night which is very cheap. Yes I would stay here again for location and the friendly family atmosphere of the place. The girls in the breakfast room remembered that I drank tea and not coffee after 2 mornings.

Reviews.Title: “My Place Was Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at My Place for three nights in early July of 2005. We found My Place to be an enjoyable hotel for the price. The rooms were small, however, they were clean and kept up very well. The bathroom likewise was small, but we had a full bathtub and plenty of hot water for showers. The continental breakfast was excellent. The food was not anything like what you would get in the United States, but it was nice to enjoy something different for breakfast. The staff of the hotel were all very nice and helpful during our stay. We also enjoyed an evening in the club downstairs in the hotel. It was a lot of fun, much like an American club. My Place is just off Earl's Court Street which is busy but still quaint. My Place is very near an Underground station which makes travel convenient. For the price, we would certainly recommend My Place.

Reviews.Title: “My Place is a decent place - liked it”
Reviews.Author: aliceandreas
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the My Place Hotel. The staff members were always helpful and polite and the continental breakfast quite good - toast, coffee, tea, juice, yogurt, cereal, sliced ham, sliced cheese, peaches and boiled eggs. We had to leave our room key at the desk when we left the hotel but it was fine. Also, the electricity is powered by your key, but it was really no problem. It was extremely convenient to the tube - less than a block. Also within a block or two were: several grocery stores, a post office, the bureau of exchange, a news stand, and a McDonalds with an internet access room (upstairs) - one pound for two hours and it was easy and cheap to email everyone back home. Overall, it was a very convenient place to stay and seemed safe, and I would stay there again. The room was small but we did have a private bathroom. It's not a fancy hotel but, as a tourist who is out of the room most of the time, it's fairly inexpensive and in a very convenient location. There's quick access to just about anything that you could need.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we thought...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just recently returned from a six night stay at the My Place Hotel, with a Virgin Atlantic package. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor, we considered changing hotels. But the prices had gone up quite a bit for the other hotel choices, so we stuck with our orginal choice. We found the location very convenient. The young people at the front desk were very nice. The carpeting in our room did have some stains. I don't know if the stains could not be removed, or from a lack of shampooing. The carpet appeared to be fairly new. We stayed on the 6th floor. I do not know if our room was an upgrade or not. It had a double bed, one window facing west. There is a fan in the room. One day it was unusually warm, but air conditioning was not turned on by the hotel. We did ask about it, because our room was on the top floor. We were told that it was not working, but from our past experience, it was not going to be turned on until a certain date. The room was very quiet during the day and at night. We did not hear other guests or people in the street. There are plenty of places to eat and it is easy to get around London from this location. The elevator worked very well. It seemed to be fairly new. We thought it was a good deal for the last week of May.

HotelInfo.Name: My Place Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1-3 Trebovir Rd. | Earl's Court, London SW5 9LS, England
